key_title: Key to the species of Crepis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Crepis
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Crepis. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant under 3 cm high; capitula sessile at base of plant
Plant (at anthesis) at least 10 cm high; capitula pedunculate
Cypselas 1.5–2.5 mm long, tapered apically but not distinctly beaked; pappus not overtopping involucral bracts; involucral bracts glabrous on inner surface; receptacle glabrous

Cypselas 4–13 mm long, at least the inner ones distinctly beaked; pappus overtopping involucral bracts in fruit; involucral bracts with fine appressed hairs on inner surface; receptacle with low ciliate ridges between attachments of cypselas
Peduncles and involucral bracts with stiff, pale, spreading, eglandular bristles 1–2 mm long
Peduncles and involucral bracts with fine pale appressed hairs, with or without spreading, usually dark, glandular hairs to c. 1.5 mm long
Plant foetid; buds nodding; inner cypselas beaked, outer cypselas not or hardly beaked, embraced by the inner involucral bracts
Plant not foetid; buds erect; cypselas all beaked, the outer ones not embraced by inner involucral bracts
